title: Add an example using spectral clustering
Add an example using spectral clustering

text: Wow, it's horribly ugly. To me, this looks like it is failing. Something seems wrong.

In agreement with @AlexandreAbraham , I will try to finish this PR.

a) One strange thing in plot_rest_spectral:
The special masker is supposed to extract only the left hemisphere, yet only the right hemisphere is depicted in the plots - error in HemisphereMasker or in the plotting function?

b) Also the clustering does not appear to work perfect in the upper example yet.
I don't undertsand this PR: it seems to merge every heterogeneous contributions. Is there any reason for that ? Shouldn't it be divided into more focussed PRs ?

> it seems to merge every heterogeneous contributions

In agreement with Alex, I will try to continue the work by him and Ben...
I agree with Bertrand. The object of this PR is the spectral clustering. The hemisphere masker should be removed (plus we've seen that it's bugged).

Just wipped the hemisphere-masker.

The spectral plot now looks like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3907396/6850011/be96d256-d3d6-11e4-9a9d-ab4e78695deb.png)

the computational cost is actually high !
It is well suited to cases where the data are characterized by their similarity (i.e. locally) rather than some global coordinates. To be pedantic, this is good at clustering data sampled on manifolds.
